lines.text: Pardon me, but uh...
But could YOU help an American whose down on HIS luck? Here!
[gives him Penguin, then runs off hysterically]
Penguins is practically chickens.

[singing while playing guitar]
Bugs Bunny came to Martinique / When he arrived he was pretty weak / His knees look like they would buckle in / His tribulations caused by a penguin / Now he's built a boat on which they both could leave / He hoped that fickle fate have nothing up her sleeve.
Say, pardon me but, could you help out a fellow American who's down on his luck?

[tossing him a coin]
Hit da road!
[singing]
If he should accomplish this daring thing / A miracle to Martinique Bugs did bring.
Hoboken! Oooooh I'm dying again!

[on a railroad car with the penguin]
Me and my big fat promises.
[Penguin cries]
All right, all right! If there's one thing I can't stand is to see a penguin cry.
Me neither. Penguins is practically chickens. And I hates to see chickens cry so much, that I has to put them out of their misery.
Eh, pardon me, Mac, but, er, rabbits is bigger than penguins.
So they are, and I love rabbit stew!
[chases Bugs; Bugs trips him up and sends him flying out the car]
What the... It's a boid! A boid in a tuxedo!
And now, then, all we have to do is find out where you came from.
[Looks up in a book]
Lets see now... Hey, what do you know? You're a penguin. And a penguin, it says here, comes from the South Pole. South Pole? Ooh, I'm dying!

[after getting the penguin on the Admiral Byrd]
Ah, this New Orleans. I think I'll stick around for the Madri Grass.
There goes the old Admiral Byrd, bound for Brooklyn.
lines.character: Man drinking mint julep in New Orleans

lines.text: Brooklyn? Hey, wait! Wait!
I leave you alone for a few minutes, and what happens? You end up on the menu.

[trying to go through the Panama Canal with the penguin]
Twenty five cents to go though this thing? Humph, we'll walk foist!
